channel.title: I installed JDK but when igo to open a .jar file i get an error
channel.description:
when i go to open the client file i get an error can anyone help??
[URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img245.imageshack.us/img245/1650/errorjarlx5.png[/img][/URL] [br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 29, 2007, 06:13:43 AM[/size][hr]basicly it doesnt recognise the java then i did what the tut that is on tut page said on how to get my pc to recognise java and puff nout
any ideas people?

item.title: I installed JDK but when igo to open a .jar file i get an error
item.dc:creator: @yakezuka yakezuka
item.description:
@yakezuka wrote:

[quote=“supra s, post:8, topic:168758”]mmhh i guess you dont want to jar your client you jsyt want to edit .java file s end then compile right ?

java files you open with notepad

compiler :

you will se there is a compiler.bat right click on it end open with notepad then change :
everything with this :

@echo off "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_03\bin\javac.exe" *.java pause[/quote]

so basicly i take everything nd replace it with that?

oki done and it just comes up blank O.o im confused[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 29, 2007, 07:25:51 AM[/size][hr]right got it working it now says that JDK isnt installed… which is not true because i have it >.>

item.source: I installed JDK but when igo to open a .jar file i get an error

item.title: I installed JDK but when igo to open a .jar file i get an error
item.dc:creator: @Kid1 -Kid-
item.description:
@Kid1 wrote:

yakezuka:

basicly it doesnt recognise the java

Then make your computer ‘recognise your Java’. Download and install Java Development Kit version 6 update 3. (JDK6.3)

Then make your computer recognise your Java version. Do this by setting your environmental variables.

Start > My Computer > System > Advanced > Environmental Variables

P.S - I cba to post how to do it… There’s a TUT in the other help section of this forum, check there

Read full topic
